theory.concept: Choosing the Right Loop and Writing Clean Code
theory.introduction: Loops are powerful â€” but choosing the right type and keeping them clean is key to writing good code.
theory.explanation: Use `for` when you know how many times to repeat. Use `while` when you loop until something happens. Avoid unnecessary nesting and infinite loops. Always update loop variables properly.
keyPoints: Use `break` for early exits, `continue` for skips
Keep indentation clean and avoid too much nesting
Check that your loops always have an exit condition

codeExamples.explanation: Use `for` when the number of iterations is known
